snippet.title: LaCie Christofle Sphere
snippet.description: The LaCie Christofle Sphere is definitely not a storage device that you need, but rather something you want for its great look and fast performance.

snippet.title: Calculate your PC's energy use
snippet.description: Microsoft's free Joulemeter utility gives you a rough estimate of a Windows system's power consumption. Plus: tips for reducing your electronics energy bill.

snippet.title: The LaCie Christofle Sphere is a lot more than a shiny ball
snippet.description: CNET Editor Dong Ngo does some psychic readings and reveals the secret of true romance with the LaCie Christofle Sphere.

snippet.title: Passwords, security, and inertia: A toxic brew
snippet.description: I went to a meeting two days ago, hopped onto the guest Wi-Fi in the conference room, and had to enter a password. That password was 0123456789. It's almost too easy for hackers.

snippet.title: Ep. 1308: Where we sweat it out with Sphere
snippet.description: Our guest today is Steve Sphere Guttenberg, the man behind CNET's Audiophiliac blog. We'll talk to him about the immortal LP, the return of music videos sans VJs, Steve's interview with Young Guru, and more.

snippet.title: The 404 1,308: Where we sweat it out with Sphere (podcast)
snippet.description: Our guest today is Steve 'Sphere' Guttenberg, the man behind CNET's Audiophiliac blog. We'll talk to him about the immortal LP, the return of music videos sans VJs, Steve's interview with Young Guru, and more.

snippet.title: Ep. 1213: Where Sphere says no to yes to the dress
snippet.description: Sphere's Law of Recurring Subject Matter argues that, given enough time, all conversations with Steve Guttenberg will inevitably become audiocentric. As usual, The Audiophiliac brings a ransom list of talking points today, including Spotify robbing musicians, Benford's law, Say Yes to the Dress, and a Monoprice controversy.

snippet.title: Calculate your GPA with GPA calculators
snippet.description: Give your brain a rest after a long semester of classes. Instead of manually trying to figure out your GPA, use GPA calculators.

snippet.title: The 404 1,213: Where Sphere says no to 'Yes to the Dress' (podcast)
snippet.description: Sphere's Law of Recurring Subject Matter argues that, given enough time, all conversations with Steve Guttenberg will inevitably become audiocentric. As usual, The Audiophiliac brings a ransom list of talking points today, including Spotify robbing musicians, Benford's law, 'Say Yes to the Dress,' and a Monoprice controversy.

snippet.title: Galaxy S4 getting 'Orb' Photo Sphere-style app, report says
snippet.description: Samsung's sequel to the S3 is tipped to lift a camera trick from the Nexus 4.
